Can anyone let me know the best way to wrap the content present within the dnd_section?
<@US878RYCT> I think you have to wrap the entire dnd_area instead. If you mean wrap in a HTML tag
If I do that then the whole background image is also getting wrapped in a wrapper.
I just need the text present within background to be wrapped with some max-width like using page center class from HubSpot boilerplate.
Then it sounds like you would need to wrap it at the module level.
Include that text in a module and style/wrap it there.

This might help explain what you are trying to do! <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tutorials/drag-and-drop-areas#3-create-a-section-with-a-module>

In this example, the background image is on a parent element of where the max-width gets set
You can also set generic max widths on section content with something like this <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/blob/master/src/css/_dnd_areas.css#L5-L9>
<@U6W3H6YN8> do you have any plans to add a “wrap in html” option?
Similar to design manager templates
<@U3ND6HWQZ> Also, one more use case here. I often need to adjust styles for mobile—including setting the order for nested flex elements. It’s pretty hard to select a specific section in that case.

Hey, just to recap on some questions that were missed if someone at HubSpot gets a chance:
1. Can you add a horizontal spacer to common modules? If we roll our own it doesn’t seem to fit with “theme modules” it’s more of a generic/common module.
2. Do you plan on adding a “wrapping html” option? This would be useful to build semantic sections put together by multiple modules.
3. Do you plan on adding the ability to add IDs/classes to rows, columns, or sections?

Hey <@UDHT6N5SM> I appreciate your ongoing thoughts and feedback on this. At this point, all I can say is that we’re talking a whole lot about all of this, and really do hope to help you all find solutions soon. I’m somewhat disconnected from the developer-specific problem-space, so I’m forwarding your thoughts to that team so that they can continue to think about it with us and help figure out the best solutions for you and all of our developer community. cc: <@U6W3H6YN8>

Hey Andrey, thanks for all of this. While I can’t comment on specific plans, I can say:

1. This feels like a fairly straightforward need, and it’s on our radar. Thanks for bringing it up.
2. That may be a great question for <@U6W3H6YN8> and his team. Ideally we work together to find an equitable solution, wherever it lives in the product. Mentioning him here to be sure that we’re talking about it collectively.
3. This is still a big question mark in our minds. While the functionality would absolutely benefit some of our users, we have to look out for unintended negative effects for our users who aren’t as code-savvy. All the same, I appreciate you bringing it up.
Apologies that I don’t have super solid answers for you. But please know that we do take this feedback very seriously, and are talking about all of these issues extensively in our own channels.
Thanks for the feedback <@UDHT6N5SM>!  Talk to me a little bit more about the  semantic sections put together by multiple modules you are interested in building.
I also will note the `dnd_area` tag does support a class parameter, and you can add multiple `dnd_area`s to a template
Thanks for the update. I’m just excited.

For the semantic modules, the main use case I have now is that I would like to build an <article> that has nested <section id> elements inside of it. Inside of those <section> elements I want to use modules to build out the content.
I can handle wrapping a dnd_area in <article> but each nested <section> would have to be a module.
I’m currently using a rich text editor to populate the sections with content but I would rather piece together the section using varying modules
Also, even just duplicating an article section is impossible if you can only add them in the template
<@U6W3H6YN8> please let me know if that makes sense. I can do a wireframe example to be more clear if it helps
Hm that might be useful to make sure I understand. Also, if you were interested, I would love to hop on a call some time to chat through pain points with the dnd_area syntax!
